definition: to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
within/among/in/middle/center/while (doing sth)/during/(dialect) OK/all right
China/Chinese/surname Zhong
to eat till full/satisfied
personal/private/selfish
sack/purse/pocket (for money)

sentences.english: Yet poor Nigerians fear that corrupt officials will pocket the savings.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的尼日利亚人害怕腐败官员会中饱私囊。

sentences.english: They all pocket each 50 cents as windfall.
sentences.chinese: 他们都将每个50美分中饱私囊，当作意外之财。

sentences.english: The policeman lined his pockets with bribes.
sentences.chinese: 这警察接受贿赂中饱私囊。

sentences.english: They are always trying to feather their nest.
sentences.chinese: 他们总是想尽办法中饱私囊。

definition: to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
to be corrupt/corruption/to embezzle
to damage the public interest for personal profit (idiom); personal profit at public expense/venal and selfish behavior
to misappropriate (public funds etc)/to embezzle
official authority used for private interests (idiom); to attain private ends by abusing public position
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
to dock/to deduct/to embezzle
see 徇私舞弊[xun4 si1 wu3 bi4]
to gain from corrupt dealing/to engage in graft/to feather one's nest
(coll.) to gain profit (usu. by underhand means)
to fabricate excuses (idiom)/to concoct various items (e.g. to pad an expense account)
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to annex/to swallow (up)/to embezzle
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to accumulate wealth/to rake in money
to prey on the people
